title: Tiglath-Pileser III
summary: Tiglath-Pileser III (Neo-Assyrian cuneiform: 𒆪𒋾𒀀𒂍𒈗𒊏 Tukultī-apil-Ešarra, meaning "my trust is in the son of the Ešarra"; Hebrew: תִּגְלַת פִּלְאֶסֶר‎‎ Tīglaṯ Pīl'eser) was a prominent king of Assyria in the eighth century BCE (ruled 745–727 BCE)[1][2] who introduced advanced civil, military, and political systems into the Neo-Assyrian Empire.[3][4]
